ai.summary: Ashclyst Red Walk is a 6.7 km moderate-length hike in the UK. The route combines woodland trails with open countryside, offering a steady pace suitable for hikers with some experience. Expect a mix of shaded paths, gentle climbs, and uneven ground that may be muddy after rain.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain includes forest paths, grassy tracks, and gentle gradients. Expect uneven surfaces, tree roots, and occasional muddy sections, with some sun-exposed stretches in open areas.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy hiking boots and weather-appropriate clothing. Check the forecast and be prepared for changes in conditions. Stay on marked trails, keep to daylight hours, and carry a map or GPS. Bring sufficient water and snacks, a small first aid kit, and a whistle or mobile phone for emergencies. Inform someone of your plans if hiking alone.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; can be enjoyed year-round with proper gear
